privacy.title: Privacy
privacy.content:
Privacy and cookie policy


If you've come here, it's a sign that you value your privacy. We understand that that's why we've prepared this document for you. You will find the rules in it processing personal data, using cookies and other files tracking technologies in connection with the use of our site website.

The administrator of the site is a private person Adrian Pietrzak. In case any doubts about the privacy policy in each you can contact us by sending an email to contact@pietrzakadrian.com

We care about your safety, your privacy, but also your time. That is why we have prepared for you a short version of the most important rules related to the protection of privacy.

By contacting us, you provide us with your personal data and we we guarantee that your data will remain confidential, secure and will not remain shared with any third parties without your explicit consent.

We use analytical tools such as Google Analytics which collect information about your visits to our site, such as subpages that you displayed, the time you spent on the website or transitions between individual subpages. For this purpose used are Google LLC cookies for the Google Analytics service. IN as part of Google Analytics, we collect demographic data and data about interests. As part of cookie settings, you can decide whether or not you agree to collect such data about you or not.

If the above information is not enough for you, below you'll find further details.

Email contact


By contacting us via email in a manner natural you give us your email address as the sender's address messages. In addition, you can also include other data in the message body personal. Providing data is voluntary, but necessary to establish contact. In this case, your data is processed in order to contact You and the basis for processing is art. 6 clause 1 lit. and GDPR, i.e. yours consent resulting from initiating contact with us. Legal basis post-contact processing is a legitimate purpose in the form archiving correspondence for internal purposes (Article 6 (1) (c) GDPR).

Cookies and other tracking technologies


Our website, like almost all other websites, uses cookies to give you the best experience related to the use of the site.
Cookies are small text information stored on yours end device (e.g. computer, tablet, smartphone) that can be read by our ICT system (own cookies) or third party IT system (third party cookies).
Some of the cookies we use are deleted at the end of the session Internet browser, i.e. after closing it (so-called session cookies). Other cookies are stored on your end device and enable us recognition of your browser the next time you visit the site (permanent cookies).
During the first visit to the website, information will be displayed to you about using cookies. Thanks to a special tool you have the ability to manage cookies from the page level. In addition, always you can change cookie settings from your browser or in delete cookies altogether. Browsers manage cookie settings on different ways. In the auxiliary menu of the web browser you will find explanations regarding changing cookie settings.
Remember that disabling or limiting cookies may cause difficulties in using our site as well as many other websites that use cookies.
Our site, like most modern websites, uses functions provided by third parties, which is associated with using cookies from third parties.
